column3: str
Thubyrgeim requires your help to put her theories to the proof.

Having heard of your research on the subject of scholars, and your newfound ability to summon a faerie familiar, Thubyrgeim hopes you might humor her with testing a theory. To that end she invites you downstairs to the guild's practice area.

Following Thubyrgeim's instructions, after a brief moment of concentration, you call forth your faerie familiar, but she has taken the form of a Topaz Carbuncle. Satisfied to see her theory proven, Thubyrgeim invites you back upstairs.
Thubyrgeim thanks you for the demonstration, encouraging you to make use of what you have learned.
Wait at the designated location.
Speak with Thubyrgeim.
<Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>, how fortuitous. Might you spare a moment?
I recently received word that you've been researching the scholars of Nym at the behest of a Marauders' Guild member, is that right?
I see... And as a result, you can now call upon a faerie to aid you. Fascinating!
Might I trouble you to meet me downstairs in the practice area? There's something I very much wish for you to try.
Please wait for me downstairs. I will be along shortly.
My apologies for the wait.
My apologies for the wait. As for what I wish for you to attempt, it is a technique similar to what you've already employed with your egi.
Now, would you be so kind as to call forth your faerie?
How charming! The tales do little to capture its beauty.
This faerie is no doubt manifested in the image of that which you most closely associate with faeries, but my research suggests this form is not immutable.

Indeed, though a fundamental form may have been incorporated into the original incantation, with sufficient concentration, I believe it possible to supplant this form with the image of another entity. Try conjuring the faerie once more─this time, with a Carbuncle in your mind's eye.
Remarkable! And with only a single attempt!
'Twould seem my theory holds, meaning this transformation should be merely superficial, and has done naught to affect its capacity for healing. Very good.
With that, we may conclude this little experiment. If you would follow me upstairs?
Thank you again for your help, <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>. That proved to be quite the spectacle.
I should hope you make use of what we've learned here today. I daresay your faerie's appearance may be without limit.
Your faerie's appearance can now be altered by using <UIForeground>F20222</UIForeground><Sheet(TextCommand,33,8)/><UIForeground>01</UIForeground>.

For example, if you wish to change the appearance of Eos to appear as Ruby Carbuncle, use the text command <UIForeground>F20222</UIForeground>/petglamour “eos” “ruby carbuncle”<UIForeground>01</UIForeground>.
For further details, enter <UIForeground>F20222</UIForeground>/? /petglamour<UIForeground>01</UIForeground>.
